hesml.taxonomy.impl

Class Vertex

  • java.lang.Object
    • hesml.taxonomy.impl.Vertex
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IVertex, java.lang.Comparable<IVertex>

    class Vertex
extends java.lang.Object
implements IVertex
    This class implements a IVertex object in the half-edge representation detailed in the paper below. Lastra-Díaz, J. J., and García-Serrano, A. (2016). HESML: a scalable ontology-based semantic similarity measures library with a set of reproducible experiments and a replication dataset. To appear in the Information Systems Journal.
    Author:
    Juan Lastra-Díaz

      Cached number of ancestors.

      Maximal depth of the vertex defined as the length of the longest path from the vertex to the root.

      Minimal depth of the vertex defined as the length of the shortest path from the vertex to the root.

      Cached count of the hyponyms.

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      (package private) void addIncomingArc(HalfEdge incomingArc)
      This function adds an incoming arc to the vertex
      int compareTo(IVertex other)
      This function compares the minimum distance field of the current vertex with the value associated to other vertex.
      void computeDistanceField(boolean weighted)
      This function computes the distance field from the current vertex using the Dijkstra algorithm and the edge weights assigned to the taxonomy.
      private int computeMaxDepth()
      This function computes the longest depth measured from the root.
      private int computeMinDepth()
      This function computes the depth measured from the root to the vertex.
      (package private) void destroy()
      This function disconnects the vertex from all the related objects in order to release all resources and to destroy the taxonomy.
      boolean equals(java.lang.Object obj)
      This function states the equality only based on the vertex ID, not the attributes.
      IVertexList getAncestors(boolean includeVertex)
      This function gets all the ancestors of the input vertex, including itself.
      private int getAncestorsCount()
      This function computes on-the-fly the ancestors count for this vertex without to include the own base vertex.
      double getAsymmetricShortestPathDist(IVertex target)
      This function computes the length of the shortest path between the current vertex and the target vertex using the weights of the oriented edges, instead of the weight of the non-oriented edges.
      IVertexList getChildren()
      This function returns a collection with the children vertexes of the current vertex.
      int getChildrenCount()
      This function returns the count of children vertexes (direct child nodes).
      private static java.util.HashSet<IVertex> getCommonSubgraph(IVertex source, IVertex target)
      This function computes the common subgraph of the input vertexes, which is defined as the union of the ancestor and descendant sets of both input vertexes.
      int getDepthMax()
      This function returns the depth of the vertex defined as the longest ascending path from the vertex to the root.
      int getDepthMaxBase1()
      This function returns longest depth + 1
      int getDepthMin()
      This function returns the depth of the vertex defined as the shortest ascending path from the vertex to the root.
      int getDepthMinBase1()
      This function returns depth + 1
      IHalfEdge getFirstOutcomingEdge()
      This function returns the first outcoming oriented edge from the vertex.

      This function computes on-the-fly the hyponym set of the vertex

      This function returns the IC-value assigned to this vertex.
      long getID()
      This function returns the unique ID assigned to the current vertex within a taxonomy.
      IHalfEdge getIncidentEdge(IVertex target)
      This function returns the oriented edge pointing to the input vertex or null if there is no any linking edge.
      int getInclusiveSubsumedLeafSetCount()
      This function returns the number of subsumed leaves including the current vertex
      private IHalfEdge getLastOutcomingArc()
      This function returns the last outcoming oriented edge from the vertex.
      double getMinDistance()
      This function returns the value of the minimum distance field.
      IVertexList getNeighbours()
      This function returns and ordered collection with the 1-ring adjacent vertexes.
      int getNonInclusiveAncestorSetCount()
      This function return the pre-computed ancestors count.
      int getNonInclusiveHyponymSetCount()
      This function returns the pre-computed hyponyms count without to include the own base vertex.
      int getNonInclusiveSubsumedLeafSetCount()
      This function returns the cached value of subsumed leaf vertexes without to include the current vertex.
      IVertexList getParents()
      This function returns the collection of parent vertexes.
      int getParentsCount()
      This function returns the number of parents of the vertex.
      java.lang.String[] getParentStringTags()
      This function returns a string vector with the string tags stored by the parent vertexes.
      double getProbability()
      This function returns the probability stored in the node.
      double getShortestPathDistanceTo(IVertex target, boolean weighted)
      This function computes the Dijkstra algorithm using the edge weights assigned to the taxonomy, or a uniform weight = 1 when it is invoked to count the edges between the current and target vertexes.
      java.lang.String getStringTag()
      This function returns the content of the string Tag field

      This function returns the set of subsumed leaves except the vertex itself.

      This function returns the tag field associated to the vertex.

      This function returns the contained taxonomy of the current vertex.

        Specified by:

      • computeDistanceField

        public void computeDistanceField(boolean weighted)
        This function computes the distance field from the current vertex using the Dijkstra algorithm and the edge weights assigned to the taxonomy. When the parameter 'weighted' is false, the function uses the edge length (weight = 1), otherwise it computes the weighted shortest path distance. Once the function is executed, the distance from the vertex to each vertex in the taxonomy can be recovered by calling the getMinDistance() function on each vertex.
        Specified by:
        computeDistanceField in interface IVertex
        Parameters:
        weighted - Flag indicating if the edge weights will be used

      • getShortestPathDistanceTo

        public double getShortestPathDistanceTo(IVertex target,
                                        boolean weighted)
        This function computes the Dijkstra algorithm using the edge weights assigned to the taxonomy, or a uniform weight = 1 when it is invoked to count the edges between the current and target vertexes.
        Specified by:
        getShortestPathDistanceTo in interface IVertex
        Parameters:
        target -
        weighted - Flag indicating the value for the weights
        Returns:

      • getCommonSubgraph

        private static java.util.HashSet<IVertex> getCommonSubgraph(IVertex source,
                                                            IVertex target)
        This function computes the common subgraph of the input vertexes, which is defined as the union of the ancestor and descendant sets of both input vertexes. The common subgraph is the set of vertexes within the taxonomy which can be part of any path linking both vertexes.
        Parameters:
        source -
        target -
        Returns:

      • getAsymmetricShortestPathDist

        public double getAsymmetricShortestPathDist(IVertex target)
        This function computes the length of the shortest path between the current vertex and the target vertex using the weights of the oriented edges, instead of the weight of the non-oriented edges. Thus, this method allows to define an asymmetric distance between vertexes in the taxonomy.
        Specified by:
        getAsymmetricShortestPathDist in interface IVertex
        Parameters:
        target - Target vertex
        Returns:
        The length of the shortest path

      • getChildren

        public IVertexList getChildren()
                        throws java.lang.Exception
        This function returns a collection with the children vertexes of the current vertex. The children collection is computed on-the-fly using the half-edge representation, thus, it is responsibility of the client code to clear the collection in order to release the used memory.
        Specified by:
        getChildren in interface IVertex
        Returns:
        Direct child vertexes
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • getIncidentEdge

        public IHalfEdge getIncidentEdge(IVertex target)
        This function returns the oriented edge pointing to the input vertex or null if there is no any linking edge.
        Specified by:
        getIncidentEdge in interface IVertex
        Parameters:
        target -
        Returns:
        Outcoming incident edge pointing to the target vertex.

      • getParents

        public IVertexList getParents()
                       throws java.lang.Exception
        This function returns the collection of parent vertexes. Like the getChildren() function, the parent collection is computed on-the-fly.
        Specified by:
        getParents in interface IVertex
        Returns:
        The parent vertexes in the taxonomy
        Throws:

        public int getNonInclusiveSubsumedLeafSetCount()
                                        throws java.lang.Exception
        This function returns the cached value of subsumed leaf vertexes without to include the current vertex. If the current value is invalid then the function forces its coomputation.

      • compareTo

        public int compareTo(IVertex other)
        This function compares the minimum distance field of the current vertex with the value associated to other vertex. This function is required by the MinPriorityQueue used implement the Djikstra algorithm.
        Specified by:
        compareTo in interface java.lang.Comparable<IVertex>
        Parameters:
        other -
        Returns:

      • computeMinDepth

        private int computeMinDepth()
                     throws java.lang.Exception
        This function computes the depth measured from the root to the vertex. The algorithm starts by computing the ancestor set of the vertex in order to reduce the search-space for the constrained top-down Djikstra algorithm that we use to measure the length.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • computeMaxDepth

        private int computeMaxDepth()
                     throws java.lang.Exception
        This function computes the longest depth measured from the root. The algorithm starts by computing the ancestor set of the vertex in order to reduce the search-space for the constrained top-down Djikstra algorithm that we use to measure the length.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception
